newsitem.title: DUBAI: Military plane with 80 aboard crashes in Iran.
newsitem.headline: Military plane with 80 aboard crashes in Iran.

text.p: An Iranian military plane with 80 people on board crashed in the northeastern corner of Iran, but there was no news of casualties, Iran's official news agency IRNA reported on Friday.
The C-130 transport plane crashed 39 km (24 miles) northeast of the city of Mashhad on Thursday, said IRNA, monitored by the British Broadcasting Corporation (BBC).
The report said there was no information on the cause of the crash or the fate of those onboard.
IRNA quoted the governor of Mashhad as saying that search teams had been sent to the area of the crash but had not yet found any wreckage.
The agency said the control tower at Mashhad airport lost contact with the plane at 6 p.m. local time (1430 GMT) on Thursday. It gave no further details.
